channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Remembering Dorothy Vogel, who collected art with her husband on civil servant salaries
item.description: Librarian Dorothy Vogel, who, with her late husband Herb, amassed a priceless collection of contemporary art in their one bedroom apartment, died on Nov. 10.
item.content:encoded: Librarian Dorothy Vogel, who, with her late husband Herb, amassed a priceless collection of contemporary art in their one bedroom apartment, died on Nov. 10.

item.title: The story of two sisters was a standout in the NPR College Podcast Challenge
item.description: A standout entry from our NPR College Podcast Challenge was a story about two sisters: One a college junior, the other a soldier in the U.S. Army.
item.content:encoded: A standout entry from our NPR College Podcast Challenge was a story about two sisters: One a college junior, the other a soldier in the U.S. Army.
item.dc:creator: Trinity Chase Hunt

item.title: Denver bison herd helps Indigenous residents connect with their heritage
item.description: Since 1914, Denver, Colorado, has maintained a small bison herd in a park outside the city. In recent years, an Indigenous group has slaughtered one annually to feed urban Native people.
item.content:encoded: Since 1914, Denver, Colorado, has maintained a small bison herd in a park outside the city. In recent years, an Indigenous group has slaughtered one annually to feed urban Native people.
item.dc:creator: Sam Brasch

item.title: The defining cultural trends of 2025, according to YouTube
item.description: A 1960s pop song, a must-have soft toy and a global anime hit are among the leaders on YouTube's year-end trends list.
item.content:encoded:
A 1960s pop song, a must-have soft toy and a global anime hit are among the leaders on YouTube's year-end trends list.

(Image credit: ©2025 Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Photojournalist Lynsey Addario on balancing work and family — when work is a war zone
item.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning photojournalist has been kidnapped and thrown from a car. Still, Addario says, parenting two young kids can be more challenging than war reporting.
item.content:encoded:
The Pulitzer Prize-winning photojournalist has been kidnapped and thrown from a car. Still, Addario says, parenting two young kids can be more challenging than war reporting.

(Image credit: Caitlin Kelly)
item.dc:creator: Sam Fragoso

item.title: A dying woman chooses friends over her husband in 'Some Bright Nowhere'
item.description: A woman with a terminal diagnosis asks her husband to leave the house in Ann Packer's new novel. Some Bright Nowhere is an absorbing book about end-of-life care and what the living owe the dying.
item.content:encoded: A woman with a terminal diagnosis asks her husband to leave the house in Ann Packer's new novel. Some Bright Nowhere is an absorbing book about end-of-life care and what the living owe the dying.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan

item.title: 'Franklin' publisher slams Hegseth for his post of the turtle firing on drug boats
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.
item.content:encoded:
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.
















(Image credit: Felix Leon)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Books out this week come from Nobel winners and independent presses
item.description: Nobel winners Olga Tokarczuk and Peter Handke bring us a reissue and a new book respectively this week. Also, a story from a fictional African country and a commentary on beauty.
item.content:encoded: Nobel winners Olga Tokarczuk and Peter Handke bring us a reissue and a new book respectively this week. Also, a story from a fictional African country and a commentary on beauty.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is a technical marvel and game design nightmare
item.description: After a decade of development, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is a beautiful but befuddling game full of misguided design decisions and annoying sidekicks.
item.content:encoded:
After a decade of development, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is a beautiful but befuddling game full of misguided design decisions and annoying sidekicks.

(Image credit: Nintendo)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Ailey dance company's new leader launches first season with 'fresh' vision
item.description: Alicia Graf Mack says her new role as artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is like coming full circle after a stint as principal dancer for the beloved group.
item.content:encoded:
Alicia Graf Mack says her new role as artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is like coming full circle after a stint as principal dancer for the beloved group.

(Image credit: Andrew Eccles)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
